abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Road Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Project will enhance road transportation
            efficiency in Nicaragua, by improving infrastructure along
            key international trunk road corridors, providing better
            access to agricultural areas, and ensuring the
            sustainability of road improvements. The components will: 1)
            finance rehabilitation, and improvements of the Managua -
            Izapa, and the Muhan - El Rama roads. Rehabilitation will be
            within the existing right of way, and will encompass bus
            pullover areas, and road shoulders to improve traffic
            safety, in addition to pavement recycling techniques to
            finalize road sections of the Managua-Izapa road, already
            improved under a previous operation, as well as the Muhan-El
            Rama road, including existing alignments, drainage, and road
            signaling works; 2) stabilize rural secondary, and tertiary
            roads, primarily within the region devastated by Hurricane
            Mitch, under private contractors, who will restore roads to
            gravel standards. Consulting services will assist the
            Ministry of Transport and Infrastructure (MTI) during
            implementation; 3) finance routine, and periodic
            maintenance, to implement spot maintenance, and major
            maintenance works by contracts, to increase private
            participation, including training, equipment, and technical
            assistance (TA) for micro-enterprises; and, 4) help MTI
            implement, and manage road sector development through TA,
            training, and studies provision.
